qa_pairs.question: How does the AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform differ from AIMMS SC Navigator, and what technical features support their functionality?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>The AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform is designed for advanced users to develop optimization-based applications and deploy them to business users, while AIMMS SC Navigator, built on the same platform, provides configurable supply chain Apps tailored for non-advanced users in supply chain teams.<cite>[S3][S4][S5]</cite></statement> <statement>The Prescriptive Analytics Platform includes an algebraic modeling language, an integrated development environment, and a graphical end-user interface, supported by connections to solvers like CPLEX, MOSEK, and FICO Xpress through the AIMMS Open Solver Interface.<cite>[S22][S23][S24]</cite></statement> <statement>Technical features such as declarative and imperative programming styles, native unit-of-measurement support, and hybrid algorithm construction via procedures enable the Prescriptive Analytics Platform to handle complex optimization problems and data workflows.<cite>[S25][S27][S28]</cite></statement> <statement>AIMMS SC Navigator leverages the underlying capabilities of the Prescriptive Analytics Platform but focuses on supply chain analytics through cloud-based Apps like Supply Chain Network Design and Sales & Operations Planning, tailored for user-friendly deployment.<cite>[S19][S20]</cite></statement>
qa_pairs.chunk:
Passage 1:
[S29] AIMMS supports a wide range of mathematical optimization problem types:

* Linear programming
* Quadratic programming
* Nonlinear programming
* Mixed-integer programming
* Mixed-integer nonlinear programming
* Global optimization
* Complementarity problems (MPECs)
* Stochastic programming
* Robust optimization
* Constraint programming

Uncertainty can be taken into account in deterministic linear and mixed integer optimization models in AIMMS through the specification of additional attributes, such that stochastic or robust optimization techniques can be applied alongside the existing deterministic solution techniques. [S30] Custom hybrid and decomposition algorithms can be constructed using the GMP system library which makes available at the modeling level many of the basic building blocks used internally by the higher level solution methods present in AIMMS, matrix modification methods, as well as specialized steps for customizing solution algorithms for specific problem types. [S31] Optimization solutions created with AIMMS can be used either as a standalone desktop application or can be embedded as a software component in other applications. [S32] ## Use in industry

AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform is used in a wide range of industries including retail, consumer products, healthcare, oil and chemicals, steel production and agribusiness. [S33] GE Grid uses AIMMS as the modeling and optimization engine of its energy market clearing software. [S34] Together with GE Grid, AIMMS was part of the analytics team of Midwest ISO that won the Franz Edelman Award for Achievement in Operations Research and the Management Sciences of 2011 for successfully applying operations research in the Midwest ISO energy market. [S35] In 2012, TNT Express, an AIMMS customer won the Franz Edleman Award for modernizing its operations and reducing its carbon footprint. [S36] The AIMMS platform was also used by the Dutch Delta team to develop and implement a new method for calculating the most efficient levels of flood protection for the Netherlands and won the Edelman prize in 2013.

Passage 2:
[S1] AIMMS


# AIMMS



**AIMMS** (acronym for **Advanced Interactive Multidimensional Modeling System**) is a prescriptive analytics software company with offices in the Netherlands, United States, and Singapore. [S2] It has two main product offerings that provide modeling and optimization capabilities across a variety of industries. [S3] The AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform allows advanced users to develop optimization-based applications and deploy them to business users. [S4] AIMMS SC Navigator, launched in 2017, is built on the AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform and provides configurable Apps for supply chain teams. [S5] SC Navigator provides supply chain analytics to non-advanced users. [S6] ## History

AIMMS B.V. [S7] was founded in 1989 by mathematician Johannes Bisschop under the name of Paragon Decision Technology. [S8] His vision was to make optimization more approachable by building models rather than programming. [S9] In Bisschop's view, modeling was able to build the bridge between the people who had problems and the people helping them solve those problems. [S10] AIMMS began as a software system designed for modeling and solving large-scale optimization and scheduling-type problems. [S11] AIMMS is considered to be one of the five most important algebraic modeling languages. [S12] Bisschop was awarded with INFORMS Impact Prize for his work in this language. [S13] In 2003, AIMMS was acquired by a small private equity firm. [S14] This led to the creation of a partnership program, further technical investment and the evolution of the platform. [S15] In 2011, the company launched AIMMS PRO, a way to deploy applications to end-users who do not have a technical background. [S16] This was quickly followed by the ability to publish and customize applications using a browser so that decision support applications are available on any device. [S17] The company grew and was in 2017 recognized as a top B2B technology in the Netherlands, and was named one of the fastest-growing companies in the Netherlands for the second consecutive year. [S18] ## AIMMS SC Navigator Platform

Along with a growing interest in embedded advanced analytics for supply chain management, AIMMS developed the AIMMS SC Navigator Platform to allow for supply chain analytics. [S19] It was launched in October 2017 with three initial cloud-based Apps: Supply Chain Network Design, Sales & Operations Planning and Data Navigator. [S20] In 2018 they added Center of Gravity and Product Lifecycle. [S21] ## AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform

The AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform consists of an algebraic modeling language, an integrated development environment for both editing models and creating a graphical user interface around these models, and a graphical end-user environment. [S22] AIMMS is linked to multiple solvers through the AIMMS Open Solver Interface. [S23] Supported solvers include CPLEX, MOSEK, FICO Xpress, CBC, Conopt, MINOS, IPOPT, SNOPT, KNITRO and CP Optimizer. [S24] AIMMS features a mixture of declarative and imperative programming styles. [S25] Formulation of optimization models takes place through declarative language elements such as sets and indices, as well as scalar and multidimensional parameters, variables and constraints, which are common to all algebraic modeling languages, and allow for a concise description of most problems in the domain of mathematical optimization. [S26] Units of measurement are natively supported in the language, and compile- and runtime unit analysis may be employed to detect modeling errors. [S27] Procedures and control flow statements are available in AIMMS for

* the exchange of data with external data sources such as spreadsheets, databases, XML and text files
* data pre- and post-processing tasks around optimization models
* user interface event handling
* the construction of hybrid algorithms for problem types for which no direct efficient solvers are available. [S28] To support the re-use of common modeling components, AIMMS allows modelers to organize their model in user model libraries.
chunk_list:
[S29] AIMMS supports a wide range of mathematical optimization problem types:

* Linear programming
* Quadratic programming
* Nonlinear programming
* Mixed-integer programming
* Mixed-integer nonlinear programming
* Global optimization
* Complementarity problems (MPECs)
* Stochastic programming
* Robust optimization
* Constraint programming

Uncertainty can be taken into account in deterministic linear and mixed integer optimization models in AIMMS through the specification of additional attributes, such that stochastic or robust optimization techniques can be applied alongside the existing deterministic solution techniques. [S30] Custom hybrid and decomposition algorithms can be constructed using the GMP system library which makes available at the modeling level many of the basic building blocks used internally by the higher level solution methods present in AIMMS, matrix modification methods, as well as specialized steps for customizing solution algorithms for specific problem types. [S31] Optimization solutions created with AIMMS can be used either as a standalone desktop application or can be embedded as a software component in other applications. [S32] ## Use in industry

AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform is used in a wide range of industries including retail, consumer products, healthcare, oil and chemicals, steel production and agribusiness. [S33] GE Grid uses AIMMS as the modeling and optimization engine of its energy market clearing software. [S34] Together with GE Grid, AIMMS was part of the analytics team of Midwest ISO that won the Franz Edelman Award for Achievement in Operations Research and the Management Sciences of 2011 for successfully applying operations research in the Midwest ISO energy market. [S35] In 2012, TNT Express, an AIMMS customer won the Franz Edleman Award for modernizing its operations and reducing its carbon footprint. [S36] The AIMMS platform was also used by the Dutch Delta team to develop and implement a new method for calculating the most efficient levels of flood protection for the Netherlands and won the Edelman prize in 2013.

Next, the technical features. For the Prescriptive Analytics Platform, [S22] describes it as having an algebraic modeling language, an IDE for editing models and creating GUIs, and a graphical end-user environment. It also links to multiple solvers via the Open Solver Interface, listed in [S23] and [S24]. The programming styles are mentioned in [S25], with declarative elements for models and imperative for data handling and algorithms. [S27] talks about units of measurement and runtime analysis. Also, [S28] mentions procedures and control flow for data exchange, processing, and hybrid algorithms.

For SC Navigator, since it's built on the Prescriptive Platform, its technical features would leverage those, but the key point is that it's configured with Apps for supply chain, as per [S19] and [S20]. The technical support would include the underlying solvers and modeling capabilities, but the specific Apps are the main feature.

qa_pairs.question: What historical milestones and strategic partnerships have shaped AIMMS's evolution, and how did they impact its product offerings?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>AIMMS was founded in 1989 by Johannes Bisschop under the name Paragon Decision Technology, with a vision to make optimization more approachable by building models rather than programming. This foundational milestone shaped its early focus on user-friendly modeling tools.<cite>[S6][S8]</cite></statement> <statement>In 2003, AIMMS was acquired by a private equity firm, leading to the creation of a partnership program, technical investments, and the evolution of its platform. This strategic move likely accelerated product development and expanded its capabilities.<cite>[S13][S14]</cite></statement> <statement>The 2011 launch of AIMMS PRO enabled deployment of applications to non-technical users, expanding its accessibility. This was followed by browser-based publishing, ensuring device compatibility and broadening its user base.<cite>[S15][S16]</cite></statement> <statement>In 2017, AIMMS launched SC Navigator, a platform built on its Prescriptive Analytics Platform, providing configurable supply chain apps. This marked a strategic shift toward industry-specific solutions, targeting non-advanced users in supply chain management.<cite>[S19][S20]</cite></statement> <statement>Strategic partnerships, such as with GE Grid and the Midwest ISO, contributed to AIMMS's recognition, including the 2011 Franz Edelman Award. Collaborations with TNT Express (2012) and the Dutch Delta team (2013) further validated its applications in energy markets and flood protection, influencing product refinements for real-world problem-solving.<cite>[S33][S34][S35][S36]</cite></statement> <statement>These milestones and partnerships collectively enhanced AIMMS's product offerings by integrating advanced analytics into industry-specific workflows, improving usability, and expanding its role in prescriptive analytics across sectors.<cite>[S3][S4][S19]</cite></statement>

qa_pairs.question: In what ways does AIMMS facilitate the integration of optimization models into broader applications, and what programming capabilities does it offer for this purpose?
qa_pairs.answer: <statement>AIMMS facilitates the integration of optimization models into broader applications by allowing them to be used as standalone desktop applications or embedded as software components in other applications.<cite>[S31]</cite></statement> <statement>AIMMS supports the construction of custom hybrid and decomposition algorithms through the GMP system library, which provides building blocks for modifying matrices and customizing solution algorithms for specific problem types.<cite>[S30]</cite></statement> <statement>The AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform integrates with multiple solvers via the AIMMS Open Solver Interface, including CPLEX, MOSEK, FICO Xpress, and others, enabling seamless incorporation of optimization models into applications.<cite>[S23]</cite></statement> <statement>AIMMS offers programming capabilities that combine declarative and imperative styles, allowing users to formulate optimization models with sets, parameters, variables, and constraints while also implementing data exchange, preprocessing, and hybrid algorithms through procedures and control flow statements.<cite>[S25][S28]</cite></statement> <statement>The platform supports data interaction with external sources such as spreadsheets, databases, and XML files, facilitating preprocessing and postprocessing tasks around optimization models.<cite>[S28]</cite></statement><statement>AIMMS enables reusability of modeling components through user model libraries, allowing modelers to organize and reuse common elements across applications.<cite>[S28]</cite></statement>

[S30] Custom hybrid and decomposition algorithms can be constructed using the GMP system library which makes available at the modeling level many of the basic building blocks used internally by the higher level solution methods present in AIMMS, matrix modification methods, as well as specialized steps for customizing solution algorithms for specific problem types. [S31] Optimization solutions created with AIMMS can be used either as a standalone desktop application or can be embedded as a software component in other applications. [S32] ## Use in industry

AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform is used in a wide range of industries including retail, consumer products, healthcare, oil and chemicals, steel production and agribusiness. [S33] GE Grid uses AIMMS as the modeling and optimization engine of its energy market clearing software. [S34] Together with GE Grid, AIMMS was part of the analytics team of Midwest ISO that won the Franz Edelman Award for Achievement in Operations Research and the Management Sciences of 2011 for successfully applying operations research in the Midwest ISO energy market. [S35] In 2012, TNT Express, an AIMMS customer won the Franz Edleman Award for modernizing its operations and reducing its carbon footprint. [S36] The AIMMS platform was also used by the Dutch Delta team to develop and implement a new method for calculating the most efficient levels of flood protection for the Netherlands and won the Edelman prize in 2013.

Passage 2:
[S1] AIMMS


# AIMMS



**AIMMS** (acronym for **Advanced Interactive Multidimensional Modeling System**) is a prescriptive analytics software company with offices in the Netherlands, United States, and Singapore. [S2] It has two main product offerings that provide modeling and optimization capabilities across a variety of industries. [S3] The AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform allows advanced users to develop optimization-based applications and deploy them to business users. [S4] AIMMS SC Navigator, launched in 2017, is built on the AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform and provides configurable Apps for supply chain teams. [S5] SC Navigator provides supply chain analytics to non-advanced users. [S6] ## History

AIMMS B.V. [S7] was founded in 1989 by mathematician Johannes Bisschop under the name of Paragon Decision Technology. [S8] His vision was to make optimization more approachable by building models rather than programming. [S9] In Bisschop's view, modeling was able to build the bridge between the people who had problems and the people helping them solve those problems. [S10] AIMMS began as a software system designed for modeling and solving large-scale optimization and scheduling-type problems. [S11] AIMMS is considered to be one of the five most important algebraic modeling languages. [S12] Bisschop was awarded with INFORMS Impact Prize for his work in this language. [S13] In 2003, AIMMS was acquired by a small private equity firm. [S14] This led to the creation of a partnership program, further technical investment and the evolution of the platform. [S15] In 2011, the company launched AIMMS PRO, a way to deploy applications to end-users who do not have a technical background. [S16] This was quickly followed by the ability to publish and customize applications using a browser so that decision support applications are available on any device. [S17] The company grew and was in 2017 recognized as a top B2B technology in the Netherlands, and was named one of the fastest-growing companies in the Netherlands for the second consecutive year. [S18] ## AIMMS SC Navigator Platform

Along with a growing interest in embedded advanced analytics for supply chain management, AIMMS developed the AIMMS SC Navigator Platform to allow for supply chain analytics. [S19] It was launched in October 2017 with three initial cloud-based Apps: Supply Chain Network Design, Sales & Operations Planning and Data Navigator. [S20] In 2018 they added Center of Gravity and Product Lifecycle. [S21] ## AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform

The AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform consists of an algebraic modeling language, an integrated development environment for both editing models and creating a graphical user interface around these models, and a graphical end-user environment. [S22] AIMMS is linked to multiple solvers through the AIMMS Open Solver Interface. [S23] Supported solvers include CPLEX, MOSEK, FICO Xpress, CBC, Conopt, MINOS, IPOPT, SNOPT, KNITRO and CP Optimizer. [S24] AIMMS features a mixture of declarative and imperative programming styles. [S25] Formulation of optimization models takes place through declarative language elements such as sets and indices, as well as scalar and multidimensional parameters, variables and constraints, which are common to all algebraic modeling languages, and allow for a concise description of most problems in the domain of mathematical optimization. [S26] Units of measurement are natively supported in the language, and compile- and runtime unit analysis may be employed to detect modeling errors. [S27] Procedures and control flow statements are available in AIMMS for

* the exchange of data with external data sources such as spreadsheets, databases, XML and text files
* data pre- and post-processing tasks around optimization models
* user interface event handling
* the construction of hybrid algorithms for problem types for which no direct efficient solvers are available. [S28] To support the re-use of common modeling components, AIMMS allows modelers to organize their model in user model libraries.
chunk_list:
[S29] AIMMS supports a wide range of mathematical optimization problem types:

* Linear programming
* Quadratic programming
* Nonlinear programming
* Mixed-integer programming
* Mixed-integer nonlinear programming
* Global optimization
* Complementarity problems (MPECs)
* Stochastic programming
* Robust optimization
* Constraint programming

Uncertainty can be taken into account in deterministic linear and mixed integer optimization models in AIMMS through the specification of additional attributes, such that stochastic or robust optimization techniques can be applied alongside the existing deterministic solution techniques. [S30] Custom hybrid and decomposition algorithms can be constructed using the GMP system library which makes available at the modeling level many of the basic building blocks used internally by the higher level solution methods present in AIMMS, matrix modification methods, as well as specialized steps for customizing solution algorithms for specific problem types. [S31] Optimization solutions created with AIMMS can be used either as a standalone desktop application or can be embedded as a software component in other applications. [S32] ## Use in industry

AIMMS Prescriptive Analytics Platform is used in a wide range of industries including retail, consumer products, healthcare, oil and chemicals, steel production and agribusiness. [S33] GE Grid uses AIMMS as the modeling and optimization engine of its energy market clearing software. [S34] Together with GE Grid, AIMMS was part of the analytics team of Midwest ISO that won the Franz Edelman Award for Achievement in Operations Research and the Management Sciences of 2011 for successfully applying operations research in the Midwest ISO energy market. [S35] In 2012, TNT Express, an AIMMS customer won the Franz Edleman Award for modernizing its operations and reducing its carbon footprint. [S36] The AIMMS platform was also used by the Dutch Delta team to develop and implement a new method for calculating the most efficient levels of flood protection for the Netherlands and won the Edelman prize in 2013.
